meanings.sent1: She was so enamored with the new puppy that she couldn't stop hugging it.
meanings.sent2: The young couple looked enamored as they walked hand in hand in the park.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's enamored expression towards the ice cream truck was priceless.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were enamored with the beauty of the sunset, losing himself in its colors.
meanings.sent5: The artist was truly enamored by the vibrant colors of the painting, finding inspiration in every stroke.

meanings.definition: Filled with a feeling of love or admiration
meanings.sent1: The grandmother's eyes were enamored as she watched her grandchildren play.
meanings.sent2: The audience was enamored by the talented singer's performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed enamored by the laser pointer, chasing it around the room.
meanings.sent4: The garden was enamored with colorful flowers, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The child's face was enamored with joy upon receiving a new toy.

meanings.definition: To be captivated or charmed by
meanings.sent1: He became enamored with the idea of traveling the world after watching a documentary.
meanings.sent2: The young girl was enamored by the magic tricks performed by the magician.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed enamored by the squeaky toy, playing with it for hours.
meanings.sent4: She was enamored by the historical architecture of the old city, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was enamored by the untouched beauty of the remote island, feeling a sense of wonder.
